html.h1: Creating your first Splunk Search Dashboard
html.p: SCOM 2012 locates dashboards within management packs. Our process to create a dashboard involves:

ul.li: Creating a management pack to hold the Splunk dashboards
Creating a dashboard within the created management pack
Adding the Splunk Search widget to the dashboard

html.p: You can locate a dashboard within any management pack. However, we recommend that you follow Microsoft best practices and create a management pack for this purpose.

html.h2: Creating a Management Pack to Contain the Dashboard View
html.p: SCOM best practices state that you create your own management packs to hold custom views. This procedure will create an empty management pack.

ul.li: Start SCOM Operations Console as an Administrator
Select the Administration Panel located in the left-hand sidebar.
In the Administration tree, select the Management Packs item.
In the Actions pane, click the "Create Management Pack" link. This will open a wizard.
In the General Properties page of the wizard, give the management pack the name "Splunk Dashboards"
Click Next to move to the Knowledge wizard page;
Click Create to finalize the management pack. The wizard will close automatically.
Start SCOM Operations Console
Select the Monitoring Panel located in the left-hand sidebar.
In the Monitoring tree, find the Splunk Dashboards folder. Right-click the folder node, and select New > Dashboard View
In the New Dashboard and Widget Wizard that appears, select the Column Layout and click Next
In the General Properties page of the wizard, give the dashboard view the name "SplunkWeb Search"
Click Next to move to the Column Count wizard page
Click Next to approve a single-column layout
Click Create to finalize the dashboard view. Once the wizard has completed click Close.

html.h2: Adding the Splunk Search widget to the SCOM Dashboard View
html.p: To add the SplunkWeb Search widget to a dashboard view:

ul.li: Select the Monitoring Panel located in the left-hand sidebar.
In the Monitoring tree, find the Splunk Dashboards folder and expand it.
Click on the SplunkWeb Search dashboard.
In the SplunWeb Search dashboard, click the link labeled "Click to add widget"
In the New Dashboard and Widget Wizard, expand the Splunk node and select the SplunkWeb Search widget
Give the widget a name and click Next.

In the SplunkWeb Configuration wizard page, enter the configuration details for the SplunkWeb host. Be sure to specify the port used from SplunkWeb access (for example, port 8000 by default). Enter credentials for a user with authorization to use the SplunkWeb search app.
Click Next, then Create to add the widget to the dashboard view. When the wizard is complete, click the close button.

html.p: Once the widget is added to a dashboard view, you will be able to use the SplunkWeb Search app in that dashboard as if you had accessed the feature from a browser.
